senses.de: something that is needed or required before you can do or achieve something else
senses.ex: Having a degree is a prerequisite for many jobs.

Tips.title: Entry Requirement
Tips.description: Prerequisite often refers to a must-have qualification or skill to start something.
Tips.example: Passing an English test is a prerequisite for this university program.

Tips.title: Beyond Basic Needs
Tips.description: It's not just about basic needs; it's often about specific conditions or standards that must be met.
Tips.example: A specific GPA may be a prerequisite for scholarship eligibility.

Tips.title: Figurative Use
Tips.description: Sometimes used metaphorically to express something very important, not only mandatory.
Tips.example: Patience is a prerequisite for mastering a new language.

senses.de: required before something else can happen or exist
senses.ex: The course had several prerequisite assignments before the final research paper.

Tips.title: Mandatory Preparation
Tips.description: As an adjective, it describes tasks or steps that are compulsory before progressing.
Tips.example: Prerequisite reading must be done before the seminar.

Tips.title: Underlying Assumption
Tips.description: Implies an assumption that the learner has certain knowledge or skills already.
Tips.example: Programming experience is a prerequisite for this software development course.

Tips.title: Initial Barrier
Tips.description: It can act as an initial barrier to entry, screening out those who are unqualified.
Tips.example: A portfolio is a prerequisite for admission to the art school.

Condition.wordDefinition:
A condition is something that must be present or fulfilled in order for a certain outcome to happen. For example, the condition for playing soccer is having a soccer ball and enough players to form two teams.

In summary, conditions are necessary for an event or situation to happen, while prerequisites are necessary for an individual to embark on or qualify for a task or opportunity.

Criterion.wordDefinition:
Criterion means a standard or rule by which something is judged or measured.

It is used to determine whether something meets a certain level of quality or performance. For example, the criterion for admission to a prestigious university might be a high GPA and impressive extracurricular activities.

Criterion is used to judge something, while prerequisite is something that must be done or achieved before progressing further.

Essential.wordDefinition:
Essential means something that is absolutely necessary and cannot be ignored or avoided. For example, water is essential for human survival.

In simpler terms, essential means something that is crucial and cannot be done without, while prerequisite means something that is required as a necessary step to achieve a particular goal.

Essential describes things that are absolutely necessary, while prerequisite describes things that are conditional or necessary for something else to happen.

Necessity.wordDefinition:
Necessity means something that is absolutely needed or required, without which something cannot happen or be done. For example, water is a necessity for human survival, without it, a person cannot live.

In simpler terms, necessity refers to something that is a must-have or essential, while prerequisite refers to something that is a requirement or condition for something else to occur.

Need.wordDefinition:
Need refers to something that is required or essential for a person or thing to function properly. For example, you need food, water, and shelter to live.

Prerequisite refers to something that is required before something else can happen. For example, before you can take an advanced math course, you may need to complete a prerequisite course in algebra.

Need refers to something that is necessary for survival or function, while prerequisite refers to something that is necessary for achieving a goal or completing a task.

Qualification.wordDefinition:
A qualification is a specific skill or attribute that makes someone suitable for a particular job or position. For example, having a certain level of education or experience might be a qualification for a job.

In general, prerequisites are more about meeting basic requirements, while qualifications are about having specific skills or qualities that make you a good fit for something.

Requirement.wordDefinition:
A requirement is something that must be met in order to comply with rules or expectations. For example, if you want to graduate high school, you might have a requirement to complete a certain number of community service hours.

So in short, a prerequisite is a specific action or accomplishment that's necessary to move forward with something, whereas a requirement is a general expectation or rule that must be met in order to fulfill a larger goal or purpose.

Requisite.wordDefinition:
However, prerequisite usually refers to something that is required before you can start or do something, while requisite generally refers to something that is required for the completion or achievement of something.

For example, if you want to take a calculus course, you might need to have completed a prerequisite course in algebra first.

A driver's license is a requisite for driving a car legally.

quotes.Text: I want a happy marriage and whatever it takes to achieve that. But I think the main prerequisite would have to be respect. He would have to respect me and vice-versa. And, that would be more important than being in love. I think respect really goes a long way. And he would have to keep me happy. And he'd have to be very, very, secure.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Shilpa Shetty

quotes.Text: I don't think I'm inherently feminist. I think the universe wants me to be feminist, and I think I resonate with that. I think it just chose me to be this female energy... thing. And I'm very drawn to female energy, but I don't really have any prerequisites in feminism. I just roll with it.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: SZA

quotes.Text: After all, the universe required ten billion years of evolution before life was even possible; the evolution of the stars and the evolving of new chemical elements in the nuclear furnaces of the stars were indispensable prerequisites for the generation of life.
quotes.Title: British Physicist
quotes.Name: John Polkinghorne

quotes.Text: Stealing bases was put to me almost as a prerequisite for staying in the game. They didn't give me a handbook on how to do it; they said do it. Under those conditions you go out and develop your own handbook.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Lou Brock

quotes.Text: The core of my platform is to change the role of money in politics, support public education and break up monopoly power. All of these are fundamental prerequisites to a responsive democracy.
quotes.Title: American Lawyer
quotes.Name: Zephyr Teachout

quotes.Text: I think we have to be careful about what we label as a prerequisite for spirituality. I don't think you have to know a lot to have a spiritual life, but knowing gives life richness.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Olympia Dukakis

quotes.Text: Sometimes people make it seem like you have to have certain prerequisites or a crazy life story in order to be successful in this world. But the truth is you really don't.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Stephen Curry

quotes.Text: The art of mastering life is the prerequisite for all further forms of expression, whether they are paintings, sculptures, tragedies, or musical compositions.
quotes.Title: Swiss Artist
quotes.Name: Paul Klee

quotes.Text: When we have all data online it will be great for humanity. It is a prerequisite to solving many problems that humankind faces.
quotes.Title: Belgian Scientist
quotes.Name: Robert Cailliau

quotes.Text: Death is the prerequisite to resurrection, the new life God intends.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: John Ortberg
